intro: Lycianthes subfalcata, commonly known as the narrowleaf nightshade, is a species of flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and tobacco. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and the plant is often found in dry, disturbed habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is generally avoided by livestock and humans.
